howItWorksPage.title: How It Works
howItWorksPage.subtitle: From purchase to first use in under 5 minutes. No code required.
howItWorksPage.step1Desc: Browse the catalog, pick what you need, and pay once. No subscriptions, no recurring fees.
howItWorksPage.step2Desc: Immediately after payment, you’ll receive a download link via email. The ZIP contains everything: the skill files, documentation, and a quick-start guide.
howItWorksPage.step3Desc: Installation takes 30 seconds. The method depends on which Claude app you use.
howItWorksPage.step3MethodCodeDesc: Extract the ZIP into your .claude/skills/ folder. Done.
howItWorksPage.step3MethodDesktopDesc: Go to Settings → Features → Skills → Add. Upload the ZIP file — it contains the skill folder with SKILL.md and all supporting files. Done.
howItWorksPage.prereqClaude: Any Claude app: Claude Code, Claude Desktop, or claude.ai
howItWorksPage.prereqPlan: Any Claude plan — Free, Pro, Max, Team, or Enterprise
howItWorksPage.faq1A: Skills work in Claude Code (terminal/VS Code), Claude Desktop (macOS/Windows), claude.ai (web), and Claude Cowork. Same skill, any platform.
howItWorksPage.faq2Q: Do I need to know how to code?
howItWorksPage.faq2A: No. Skills work through natural language conversation with Claude. Just ask, and Claude uses the skill automatically.
howItWorksPage.faq3Q: What if Claude gets an update — will skills break?
howItWorksPage.faq3A: No. Skills are plain text files that Claude reads as instructions — they don’t depend on any specific Claude version. They work today and will keep working with future updates.
howItWorksPage.faq4Q: Can I modify a skill after buying it?
howItWorksPage.faq4A: Absolutely. Skills are plain text files (Markdown, Python). You own them and can customize anything.
howItWorksPage.installDesktopSteps:
1. Open Settings → Features → Skills
2. Click “Add”
3. Upload the ZIP file (it contains the skill folder with SKILL.md and all subfolders)
4. The skill appears in your list — ready to use

whatAreSkillsPage.title: What Are Claude Skills?
whatAreSkillsPage.subtitle: Everything you need to know before your first purchase.
whatAreSkillsPage.claudeCodeP1: Claude skills work across the entire Claude ecosystem. Whether you use Claude Code in your terminal, Claude Desktop on macOS or Windows, claude.ai in your browser, or Claude Cowork for autonomous tasks — your skills work everywhere.
whatAreSkillsPage.claudeCodeP2: Skills are plain text files that live in your .claude/skills/ folder. Every Claude app reads them automatically. Install once, use anywhere.
whatAreSkillsPage.claudeCodeP3: Skills are available on all Claude plans, including Free, Pro, Max, Team, and Enterprise.
whatAreSkillsPage.whatIsSkillP1: A skill is a structured knowledge package that gives Claude a new capability.
whatAreSkillsPage.whatIsSkillP2: Claude out of the box is a brilliant generalist. It can write code, answer questions, and help with many tasks. But it doesn’t know your specific sales methodology. It doesn’t have an evidence-based career coaching framework. It can’t create n8n workflows using best practices from 1,500 real templates.
whatAreSkillsPage.whatIsSkillP3: A skill changes that. When you install a skill, you’re giving Claude specialized knowledge and structured workflows that transform it from a generalist into a domain expert.
whatAreSkillsPage.whatIsSkillAnalogy: Skills are to Claude what apps are to your smartphone. Your phone can do a lot out of the box — but the apps are what make it indispensable.
whatAreSkillsPage.whatsInsideP1: A professional skill is not a single prompt. It’s an entire system. Here’s what you typically find inside:
whatAreSkillsPage.whatsInsideP2: The SKILL.md file is what Claude reads to understand its new capability. The references/ folder contains the domain knowledge. The scripts/ folder has executable tools. Together, they create a complete working system — not a one-shot prompt.
whatAreSkillsPage.benefit1Desc: Without a skill, asking Claude to “qualify this deal” gives different results each time. With a sales skill, it uses a structured scoring framework — same methodology, every time.
whatAreSkillsPage.benefit2Desc: The Vera Career Coach skill contains 6 evidence-based assessments backed by academic research. You get coaching methodology that would cost €200/session from a human coach.
whatAreSkillsPage.benefit3Desc: Install a skill in 30 seconds. No training, no onboarding, no learning curve. Just mention the skill and Claude knows what to do.
whatAreSkillsPage.installStep1Desc: After purchase, you receive a ZIP file via email. Save it anywhere on your computer.
whatAreSkillsPage.installStep2Code: Claude Code: extract to the skills folder
whatAreSkillsPage.installStep2Desktop: Claude Desktop / claude.ai: add via Settings
whatAreSkillsPage.installStep2DesktopDesc: Open Settings → Features → Skills → click “Add” and upload the ZIP file. It contains the skill folder with SKILL.md and all supporting subfolders. The skill appears in your list immediately.
whatAreSkillsPage.installStep3Desc: Mention the skill by name in your conversation, and Claude will use it automatically. No restart required.
whatAreSkillsPage.prereqClaudeSub: Any Claude plan (Free, Pro, Max, Team, Enterprise)
whatAreSkillsPage.prereqClaudeCode: Any Claude app: Claude Code, Claude Desktop, or claude.ai
whatAreSkillsPage.prereqInternet: Internet connection (for Claude API calls; skills are local files)
whatAreSkillsPage.faq1A: Claude Code, Claude Desktop, claude.ai, and Claude Cowork. Skills are plain text files that work across all platforms.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq2Q: Do I need to know how to code?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq2A: No. Skills work through natural language conversation with Claude.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq3Q: What if Claude gets an update — will skills break?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq3A: No. Skills are plain text files that Claude reads as instructions — they don’t depend on any specific Claude version. They work today and will keep working with future updates.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq4Q: Can I modify a skill after buying it?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq4A: Absolutely. Skills are plain text files (Markdown, Python). You own them and can customize anything.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq5Q: How is this different from a ChatGPT prompt?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq5A: A prompt is a single instruction. A skill is a complete system with methodology, knowledge base, templates, and scripts — typically 10–100 files.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq6A: Skills are digital products delivered instantly. Due to their nature, all sales are final. We recommend reading the skill detail page carefully before purchasing.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq7Q: Do I get updates when new versions are released?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq7A: Each skill has a version number and a public changelog. When we release a new version with improvements and new features, it will be available in the catalog.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq8Q: Can I use one skill on multiple computers?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq8A: Yes. Your license is per-person, not per-device. Install on as many of your own machines as you need.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq9Q: What happens if I lose the ZIP file?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq9A: Contact support and we’ll resend the download link.
whatAreSkillsPage.faq10Q: Are skills in English or Italian?
whatAreSkillsPage.faq10A: Skills are written in English by default. Claude will interact with you in your preferred language regardless — the skill’s knowledge is language-independent.

aboutPage.title: About Skillwire
aboutPage.subtitle: Built by a practitioner, not a prompt factory.
aboutPage.creatorRole: Sales & GTM Leader at iSquared (Var Group)
aboutPage.creatorBio1: I’m a B2B sales professional and AI practitioner who uses Claude every day. Not as a side project — as my primary work tool. From qualifying enterprise deals to coaching career transitions to automating content pipelines, Claude is at the center of my workflow.
aboutPage.creatorBio2: I built 25+ skills for my own use before realizing they could help others. Each skill on Skillwire is something I use in production — battle-tested in real sales negotiations, real coaching sessions, and real automation workflows.
aboutPage.creatorBio3: Skillwire exists because I believe the gap between AI’s potential and what most people actually get from it comes down to one thing: structured knowledge. A good skill turns Claude from a clever chatbot into a domain expert.
aboutPage.whyP1: Most Claude users interact with a brilliant generalist. They get good answers, but not great ones. Not consistent ones. Not methodology-driven ones.
aboutPage.whyP2: Skills change that. They give Claude the structured frameworks, domain knowledge, and validated workflows that turn generic responses into professional-grade output.
aboutPage.whyP3: I created Skillwire to be the place where professionals find skills they can trust — skills built by someone who actually uses them, not generated by a prompt factory.
